analyzed: de dag lus tshig cing sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen pas nyam thag pa'i skad 'byin to //

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tsho de dag gi gan du song ste dris pa /

analyzed: khyod yid ches par mi 'gyur ro //

original: des smras pa /

original: de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: ji tsam na bdag cag tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / sdig pa'i @150b chos can du gyur nas /

analyzed: der dge slong bslab pa 'dod pa mang po dag bsregs pas / las de'i rnam par smin pas bdag cag nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skyes te /
translated: There, many monks who desired training were burned.🔽As the result of that karma, we were born among the limited-life hell beings.

original: ces don 'di rgya cher brjod na legs so //
analyzed: ces don 'di rgya cher brjod na legs so //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos smras pa /

original: des smras pa /

analyzed: de nyid bram ze dge sbyong dge slong yin //

analyzed: de dag gis bsams pa /

original: grub pa dang / bde ba'i bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa dang / grub pa dang /
analyzed: grub pa dang / bde ba'i bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa dang / grub pa dang /
translated: “The wise ones who see that they will attain the unsurpassed nirvāṇa, which is accomplished and blissful, should only aspire to go forth.

original: bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa las nyams na yang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa🔽dang / rab tu byung ba ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos dam pa yang dag par song ba; yang dag par zhugs pa /
analyzed: bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa las nyams na yang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa dang / rab tu byung ba ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos dam pa yang dag par song ba; yang dag par zhugs pa /
translated: The wise who see this should aspire to go forth.

original: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi rnam grangs du mas bsngags so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi rnam grangs du mas bsngags so //
translated: “Going forth is praised in many ways by the buddhas and by the excellent disciples of the Buddha, who have gone well and are well established.

original: zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs @158a *//🔽so zhes gsungs kyis rab tu byung zhig /
analyzed: zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs @158a *// so zhes gsungs kyis rab tu byung zhig /
translated: The wise who see this should aspire to go forth.”

original: de'i phyir ci bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rab tu 'byung ngam /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rab tu 'byung ngam /
translated: Therefore, should you go forth in the presence of the Blessed One,

original: 'on te kho bo las /
analyzed: 'on te kho bo las /
translated: or from me?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis  spyan sngar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis  spyan sngar ro //
translated: “In the presence of the Blessed One.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos smras pa /
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita said,

original: gal te de lta na tshur shog /
analyzed: gal te de lta na tshur shog /
translated: “If that’s the case, then come!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dong ngo //
translated: Let’s go before the Blessed One.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: btsun pa dge 'dun 'tsho ci bdag cag gi rdzu 'phrul gyis bzhud dam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge 'dun 'tsho ci bdag cag gi rdzu 'phrul gyis bzhud dam /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, should we go by our own magical power or by yours?”

original: 'on te khyod kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis /
analyzed: 'on te khyod kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis /
translated: “By my magical power.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos thos nas nyam nga bar gyur te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos thos nas nyam nga bar gyur te /
translated: When Venerable Saṅgharakṣita heard this, he became anxious.

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: bdag gi mthus 'di dag gis yon tan gyi tshogs 'di lta bu thob na /
analyzed: bdag gi mthus 'di dag gis yon tan gyi tshogs 'di lta bu thob na /
translated: “Since they have attained such a great heap of good qualities by my power,

original: bdag ni gzings lta bur gyur ba lta snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag ni gzings lta bur gyur ba lta snyam nas /
translated: I have become like a ship.”

original: de bzhin nyams shing gyur te smras pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyams shing gyur te smras pa /
translated: He became depressed and said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bo la bya ba cung zhig yod kyis re zhig yud tsam zhig sdod cig ces de shing ljon pa zhig gi drung du brten nas skyil mo krung bcas te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bo la bya ba cung zhig yod kyis re zhig yud tsam zhig sdod cig ces de shing ljon pa zhig gi drung du brten nas skyil mo krung bcas te /
translated: “Venerable sirs, I have a little business to attend to, so please wait a moment.” He went to the foot of a tree, sat down cross-legged,

original: lus drang por bsrangs nas /
analyzed: lus drang por bsrangs nas /
translated: and straightened his body.

original: dran pa phyogs par bzhag ste 'dug go ;bcom ldan 'das kyis mang du thos pa la phan yon lnga yod de /
analyzed: dran pa phyogs par bzhag ste 'dug go ;bcom ldan 'das kyis mang du thos pa la phan yon lnga yod de /
translated: The Blessed One has said that there are five benefits to being learned.

original: lnga gang zhe na /🔽phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / de'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na / phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / de'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa /
translated: What are those five?

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa yin no zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa yin no zhes gsungs pas /
translated: They are expertise in the aggregates, expertise in the elements, expertise in the sense sources, expertise in dependent origination, and the fact that their instructions and follow-up teachings do not depend on others.

original: des brtson 'grus brtsams pas /
analyzed: des brtson 'grus brtsams pas /
translated: So he applied himself with diligence,

original: 'khor @158b ba'i 'khor lo cha lnga ba g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba 'di nyid rig ste /
analyzed: 'khor @158b ba'i 'khor lo cha lnga ba g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba 'di nyid rig ste /
translated: and he came to know this very five-part wheel of life and death, with its moving and unmoving parts.

original: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad nyams pa dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyis zil gyis mnan nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad nyams pa dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyis zil gyis mnan nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas /
translated: He overcame all conditioned things with the nature of decline, fall, dispersal, and destruction, and he abandoned all afflictive emotions.

original: rigs kyi bu dag gang gi phyir skra dang kha sbu dag bregs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag gang gi phyir skra dang kha sbu dag bregs te /
translated: “Noble sons, it is for this reason that you should shave your heads and beards,

original: gos dur smrig dag bgos nas yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung bar byed pa /
analyzed: gos dur smrig dag bgos nas yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung bar byed pa /
translated: They go forth from home to homelessness in the perfectly authentic faith, wearing the saffron-colored robes.

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bla na med pa de /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bla na med pa de /
translated: They reach the unsurpassed, holy, and pure life.

original: tshe de nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: tshe de nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te /
translated: In that very life, they manifest it through their own supernormal knowledge.

original: bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: They accomplish it and proclaim, ‘My births have been exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
translated: I have practiced the holy life.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.🔽I know that I will not experience another existence after this one.’

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed cing dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /🔽bong ba dang gser du mnyam pa /
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed cing dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba / bong ba dang gser du mnyam pa /
translated: They are free from attachment to the three realms.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: They have minds that are like space or the palm of the hand.

original: tsan dan dang ste'ur mnyam pa /
analyzed: tsan dan dang ste'ur mnyam pa /
translated: They are equal toward sandalwood and goat’s dung.

original: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing /
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing /
translated: They have split the egg of ignorance with the vajra of wisdom.

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: They have attained knowledge, supernormal knowledge, and discriminations.

original: srid pa dang / 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
analyzed: srid pa dang / 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
translated: He turned his back on worldly existence, on gain, honor, and praise,

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra par bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra par bya bar gyur to //
translated: and became an object of worship, veneration, and obeisance for the gods, including Indra and Upendra.

original: des de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: des de dag la smras pa /
translated: He said to them,

original: shes ldan dag kho bo'i chos gos kyi grva nas zung zhig dang / kho bo'i rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes ldan dag kho bo'i chos gos kyi grva nas zung zhig dang / kho bo'i rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: “Sirs, hold on to the corner of my robe and I will take you through my magical power.”

original: de dag de'i chos gos kyi grva nas 'jus @159a *//
analyzed: de dag de'i chos gos kyi grva nas 'jus @159a *//
translated: They held on to the corner of his robe.

original: pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba ltar rdzu 'phrul gyis steng gi nam mkha' la song ngo //
analyzed: pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba ltar rdzu 'phrul gyis steng gi nam mkha' la song ngo //
translated: Then Venerable Saṅgharakṣita rose up into the sky like a swan king with outstretched wings.

original: ji tsam na tshong pa lnga brgya po de dag rdzas 'khos su 'bebs par byed pa na /
analyzed: ji tsam na tshong pa lnga brgya po de dag rdzas 'khos su 'bebs par byed pa na /
translated: Meanwhile, the five hundred merchants were unloading their goods.

original: de dag gis de mthong nas /
analyzed: de dag gis de mthong nas /
translated: When they saw him,

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: they said,

original: 'phags pa dge 'dun 'tsho khyod byon tam /
analyzed: 'phags pa dge 'dun 'tsho khyod byon tam /
translated: “Noble Saṅgharakṣita, have you come?”

original: byon pa legs so //
analyzed: byon pa legs so //
translated: “Welcome!

original: kho bo 'ongs so /
analyzed: kho bo 'ongs so /
translated: I have come.

original: gang du bzhud /
analyzed: gang du bzhud /
translated: Where are you going?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He replied,

original: rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po 'dod pas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po 'dod pas /
translated: “Son of noble family, those five hundred of us wish to go before the Blessed One in order to go forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya and to complete the monastic training and become monks.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'gro'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'gro'o //
translated: “We are going before the Blessed One.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa dge 'dun 'tsho bdag cag kyang rab tu 'byung gis /
analyzed: 'phags pa dge 'dun 'tsho bdag cag kyang rab tu 'byung gis /
translated: “Noble Saṅgharakṣita, we too wish to go forth.

original: bobs la bdag cag rdzas 'khos su 'bebs kyi bar du re zhig gzhes su gsol /
analyzed: bobs la bdag cag rdzas 'khos su 'bebs kyi bar du re zhig gzhes su gsol /
translated: Please wait a moment while we divide our possessions.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos babs pa dang / de dag gis rdzas 'khos su phab bo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos babs pa dang / de dag gis rdzas 'khos su phab bo //
translated: The venerable Saṅgharakṣita descended, and they divided their possessions.

original: de nas des rigs kyi bu stong po de dag khrid nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ngo //
analyzed: de nas des rigs kyi bu stong po de dag khrid nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: Then, leading those one thousand sons of noble family, he went to the Blessed One.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i gung la bzhugs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i gung la bzhugs te /
translated: At that time the Blessed One was seated in the midst of a gathering of many hundreds of monks.

original: chos ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: and he taught the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tsho skyes dang bcas te thag ring po kho na nas 'ong ba gzigs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tsho skyes dang bcas te thag ring po kho na nas 'ong ba gzigs so //
translated: The Blessed One saw that the venerable Saṅgharakṣita was coming from far away with his new disciples.

original: gzigs nas kyang dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Having seen him, he said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong dge 'dun 'tsho thag ring po @159b nas 'ong ba mthong ngam /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong dge 'dun 'tsho thag ring po @159b nas 'ong ba mthong ngam /
translated: “Monks, do you see the monk Saṅgharakṣita coming from far away?”

original: btsun pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: btsun pa mthong ngo //
translated: “Yes, we do, Lord.”

original: dge slong dag dge slong dge 'dun 'tsho 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la skyes dang bcas shing 'ong ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong dge 'dun 'tsho 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la skyes dang bcas shing 'ong ste /
translated: “Monks, this monk Saṅgharakṣita is coming to the Tathāgata with his new disciples.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes ni 'di ltar gdul ba las gzhan pa lta bu med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes ni 'di ltar gdul ba las gzhan pa lta bu med do //
translated: The Tathāgata’s new disciples are like this, but not like those of others.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tsho bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tsho bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then the venerable Saṅgharakṣita went to the Blessed One. When he arrived,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /🔽phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te / phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet🔽and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: When he had sat down to one side,

original: bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The venerable Saṅgharakṣita said to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa rigs kyi bu stong po 'di dag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos por 'tshal na /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag rab tu 'byung du gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa rigs kyi bu stong po 'di dag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos por 'tshal na / bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag rab tu 'byung du gsol /
translated: “Lord, these one thousand sons of noble families wish to go forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya and to be fully ordained as monks.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad du gsol /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas rab tu phyung zhing /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad du gsol / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas rab tu phyung zhing /
translated: So, Blessed One, out of compassion for them, please let them go forth and grant them full ordination.”🔽The Blessed One let them go forth with the words “Come, join me, monks,”

original: dge slong dag tshur shog tshangs par spyod pa spyod cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi bka'i mjug kho nar skra byi pa dang snam sbyar gyon par gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag tshur shog tshangs par spyod pa spyod cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi bka'i mjug kho nar skra byi pa dang snam sbyar gyon par gyur te /
translated: and with the words “Monks, practice pure conduct,” he ordained them.

original: skra dang kha spu zhag bdun skyes pa tsam dang / lag na lhung bzed dang bya ma bum thogs pa dang / dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya lon pa'i spyod lam lta bur gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: skra dang kha spu zhag bdun skyes pa tsam dang / lag na lhung bzed dang bya ma bum thogs pa dang / dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya lon pa'i spyod lam lta bur gnas par gyur to //
translated: Their hair and beards had grown for seven days, and they were holding begging bowls and water jars, and they were standing there with the deportment of monks who had been ordained for one hundred years.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: They said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas tshur shog bka' stsal pas //🔽skra byi snam sbyar gyon pa'i @160a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas tshur shog bka' stsal pas // skra byi snam sbyar gyon pa'i @160a *//
translated: “The Tathāgata said, ‘Come forth!’

original: lus ldan zhing //
analyzed: lus ldan zhing //
translated: Our hair fell out and we were clothed in the outer robe.

original: mod la dbang po rab zhi gnas gyur te //
analyzed: mod la dbang po rab zhi gnas gyur te //
translated: Instantly our faculties were calmed and we were at peace.

original: sangs rgyas dgongs pas lus gzugs bkab par gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dgongs pas lus gzugs bkab par gyur //
translated: The Buddha’s intention covered our bodies with robes.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la gdams ngag stsal nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la gdams ngag stsal nas /
translated: Then the Bhagavān gave them instructions,

original: de dag gis brtson pa dang 'bad pa dang brtsal bas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byas te /
analyzed: de dag gis brtson pa dang 'bad pa dang brtsal bas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byas te /
translated: and they abandoned all afflictive emotions through diligence, effort, and exertion, and manifested arhatship.

original: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: They were free from desire for the three realms,

original: bong ba dang gser du mnyam pa /
analyzed: bong ba dang gser du mnyam pa /
translated: and they were equal toward a clod of earth and a piece of gold.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa /🔽tsan dan dang ste'ur mnyam pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa / tsan dan dang ste'ur mnyam pa /
translated: He was equal to sandalwood and a lump of earth.

original: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing /
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing /
translated: He had broken open the eggshell of ignorance with the vajra of wisdom.

original: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: He had attained the superknowledges and the discriminations.

original: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
analyzed: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
translated: He had turned his back on the acquisitions and honors of cyclic existence and of the desire realm.

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra bar bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra bar bya bar gyur to //
translated: He was worshipped, revered, and honored by Indra, Upendra, and the gods.

analyzed: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //

original: bde bar gshegs pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: “Saṅgharakṣita, in the past, in this fortunate eon, when people lived as long as twenty thousand years, there appeared in the world a teacher named Buddha Kāśyapa, a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened one, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, and a blessed one.

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: He went to the Kuru country and stayed in a town called Kampilla.🔽There, in a charnel ground called Saṃsthānavana, he was accompanied by one thousand two hundred and fifty monks.

original: bla na med pa lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /

original: nyan thos su gyur to /
analyzed: nyan thos su gyur to /

analyzed: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi rtsig pa mchil mas ma rung bar byas pas /

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas rtsig pa 'dra ba dag tu gyur to //🔽khyod kyis sems can ka ba 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba des kyang /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas rtsig pa 'dra ba dag tu gyur to // khyod kyis sems can ka ba 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba des kyang /
translated: As the result of that action, they became like walls.

original: dge slong dag tu gyur pa na /
analyzed: dge slong dag tu gyur pa na /
translated: “Those beings you saw who were like pillars were formerly monks.

original: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi ka ba snabs kyis ma rung bar byas pas /
analyzed: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi ka ba snabs kyis ma rung bar byas pas /
translated: They defaced a pillar belonging to the saṅgha with their mucus.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas ka ba 'dra ba dag tu gyur to //
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas ka ba 'dra ba dag tu gyur to //
translated: The fruition of that karma is that they are now like pillars.

original: khyod kyis sems can shing ljon pa 'dra ba dag dang / lo ma 'dra ba dag dang / me tog 'dra ba dag dang / 'bras bu 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de dag kyang dge slong dag tu gyur pa na /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can shing ljon pa 'dra ba dag dang / lo ma 'dra ba dag dang / me tog 'dra ba dag dang / 'bras bu 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de dag kyang dge slong dag tu gyur pa na /
translated: “You saw sentient beings who were like trees, leaves, flowers, and fruits. They were also monks.

original: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi shing ljon pa dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag gang zag gi longs spyod du spyad pas /
analyzed: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi shing ljon pa dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag gang zag gi longs spyod du spyad pas /
translated: When they were monks, they used the trees, leaves, flowers, and fruits of the saṅgha for their own enjoyment.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas shing ljon pa 'dra ba dag dang / lo ma 'dra ba dag dang / me tog 'dra ba dag dang / 'bras bu 'dra ba dag tu gyur to //
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas shing ljon pa 'dra ba dag dang / lo ma 'dra ba dag dang / me tog 'dra ba dag dang / 'bras bu 'dra ba dag tu gyur to //
translated: The fruition of that karma is that they are now like trees, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: khyod kyis sems can thag pa 'dra ba dag dang / phyags ma 'dra ba dag mthong ba de dag kyang dge slong dag tu gyur pa na /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can thag pa 'dra ba dag dang / phyags ma 'dra ba dag mthong ba de dag kyang dge slong dag tu gyur pa na /
translated: “You saw sentient beings who were like ropes and brooms. They were also monks.

original: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi thag pa dang phyags ma gang zag gi longs spyod du spyad pas /
analyzed: de dag gis dge 'dun gyi thag pa dang phyags ma gang zag gi longs spyod du spyad pas /
translated: They used the rope and broom of the saṅgha for their own purposes.

analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas thag pa 'dra ba dag dang / phyags ma 'dra ba dag tu gyur to //
translated: As the result of that karma, they were born as ropes and brooms.

original: khyod kyis sems can phor pa 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de dag ni /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can phor pa 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de dag ni /
translated: “You may wonder, ‘What were those sentient beings who looked like pots?’

original: dge tshul skom gyi gtsang sbyor du gyur pa na /
analyzed: dge tshul skom gyi gtsang sbyor du gyur pa na /
translated: They were novice monks who were in charge of cleaning the water vessels.

original: de dag phor pa 'khrud par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de dag phor pa 'khrud par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When they were washing the pots,

original: dge slong glo bur @161b du 'ongs pa dag lhags nas /🔽de dag gis dge tshul de dag la dris pa /
analyzed: dge slong glo bur @161b du 'ongs pa dag lhags nas / de dag gis dge tshul de dag la dris pa /
translated: some newly arrived monks came.🔽They asked the novice monks,

original: dge tshul dag /
analyzed: dge tshul dag /
translated: ‘Novice monks,

analyzed: ci dge 'dun la skom 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: will there be water for the saṅgha?’

original: dge tshul de dag ser snas dkris te smras pa /
analyzed: dge tshul de dag ser snas dkris te smras pa /
translated: The novice monks, overcome by stinginess, said,

original: kho bo cag gi phor pa bkrus pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phor pa bkrus pa mthong ngam /
translated: ‘Do you see us washing the pots?

original: skom 'thungs zin to //
analyzed: skom 'thungs zin to //
translated: We have already drunk the water.’

original: de dag gis bsams pa /🔽dus yol ba blta snyam nas re ba med par gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis bsams pa / dus yol ba blta snyam nas re ba med par gyur te /
translated: They thought,🔽‘We will see if it is too late.’🔽They lost hope,

original: bzhin gyur cing nyams te dong bas /
analyzed: bzhin gyur cing nyams te dong bas /
translated: and with downcast faces, they left.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas phor pa 'dra ba dag tu gyur to; ;khyod kyis sems can gtun 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de dag kyang dge slong dag tu gyur pa na /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas phor pa 'dra ba dag tu gyur to; ;khyod kyis sems can gtun 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de dag kyang dge slong dag tu gyur pa na /
translated: The maturation of that karma is that they were born as mortars.🔽“You see those sentient beings who are like pestles? They were also monks.

original: de dag la lhung bzed kyi las dag byung nas /
analyzed: de dag la lhung bzed kyi las dag byung nas /
translated: When they were monks, they were assigned the work of washing the begging bowls.

original: de na dge tshul dgra bcom pa gcig dam bzhag par bskos pa de la de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de na dge tshul dgra bcom pa gcig dam bzhag par bskos pa de la de dag gis smras pa /
translated: There was a novice monk who was an arhat who was appointed to be the overseer. They said to him,

original: dge tshul kho bo cag la gtun du 'bru mar gyi tshig ma nyung zhig brdungs te byin cig /
analyzed: dge tshul kho bo cag la gtun du 'bru mar gyi tshig ma nyung zhig brdungs te byin cig /
translated: ‘Novice, please grind a little oil-seed cake in the mortar and give it to us.’

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,🔽‘Elders, I am busy. Please wait a moment. I will give it to you later.’

original: gnas brtan dag bdag brel gyis re zhig yud tsam zhig bzhes shig dang / slad kyis gsol lo; ;de dag mi bzod pa skyes nas kun nas dkris pa drag pos smras pa /
analyzed: gnas brtan dag bdag brel gyis re zhig yud tsam zhig bzhes shig dang / slad kyis gsol lo; ;de dag mi bzod pa skyes nas kun nas dkris pa drag pos smras pa /
translated: They became angry and said with strong animosity,

original: dge tshul gal te kho bo cag gtun la reg tu rung na kho bo cag gis khyod nyid gtun du bcug ste brdung bar yang bya na /
analyzed: dge tshul gal te kho bo cag gtun la reg tu rung na kho bo cag gis khyod nyid gtun du bcug ste brdung bar yang bya na /
translated: ‘Novice, if it is appropriate for us to touch the mortar, we would put you in the mortar and pound you,

original: 'bru mar tshigs ma nyung zhig lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'bru mar tshigs ma nyung zhig lta ci smos /
translated: let alone a little oil-seed cake!’

original: dge tshul des bsams pa /
analyzed: dge tshul des bsams pa /
translated: The novice thought,

original: 'di dag kun nas dkris pa drag pos dkris pas /
analyzed: 'di dag kun nas dkris pa drag pos dkris pas /
translated: “These people are bound by strong fetters.

original: gal te bdag gis 'di dag la lan btab na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis 'di dag la lan btab na /
translated: If I respond to them,

original: lhag par yang rab tu 'khrug par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: lhag par yang rab tu 'khrug par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: they will become even more agitated.”

original: des cang mi smra bar bsdad nas /
analyzed: des cang mi smra bar bsdad nas /
translated: So he remained silent.

original: gang gi tshe de dag kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba de'i tshe na /
translated: When they were free of their fetters,

original: gang du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: gang du song ste smras pa /
translated: he went to them and said,

original: gnas brtan dag khyed kyis bdag su lags mkhyen tam /
analyzed: gnas brtan dag khyed kyis bdag su lags mkhyen tam /
translated: “Elders, do you know who I am?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: shes te @162a *//
analyzed: shes te @162a *//
translated: “We know.

original: khyod ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba'i dge tshul yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba'i dge tshul yin no //
translated: You are a novice who went forth in the doctrine of the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa.

original: kho bo cag kyang dge slong yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang dge slong yin no //
translated: We are monks.”

original: gnas brtan dag gal te de ltar lags kyis kyang 'di ltar bdag gis ni rab tu byung bas bgyi ba gang lags pa de bgyis so //
analyzed: gnas brtan dag gal te de ltar lags kyis kyang 'di ltar bdag gis ni rab tu byung bas bgyi ba gang lags pa de bgyis so //
translated: “Elders, even if that is so, I have done what I had to do as a renunciant.

original: ci zhig byas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du bgyis so //
analyzed: ci zhig byas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du bgyis so //
translated: What did I do? I attained arhatship through the abandonment of all afflictive emotions.

original: khyed ni 'ching ba mtha' dag gis bcings ba lags la /
analyzed: khyed ni 'ching ba mtha' dag gis bcings ba lags la /
translated: You are bound by all the fetters,

original: bdag ni 'ching ba thams cad las nges par grol ba lags na /
analyzed: bdag ni 'ching ba thams cad las nges par grol ba lags na /
translated: while I am completely free from all fetters.

original: khyed kyis ngag gi las rtsub po brjod kyis sdig pa sdig pa las shogs shig dang / de lta na las srabs pa nyid dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su mthar thug par 'gyur ro;/
analyzed: khyed kyis ngag gi las rtsub po brjod kyis sdig pa sdig pa las shogs shig dang / de lta na las srabs pa nyid dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su mthar thug par 'gyur ro;/
translated: You should confess your wrongdoing, and thus your karma will be reduced, exhausted, and brought to an end.”

original: de dag gis sdig pa sdig pa las bshags kyang /
analyzed: de dag gis sdig pa sdig pa las bshags kyang /
translated: But even though they confessed their wrongdoing,🔽the karma ripened such that they became pestle-like.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas gtun 'dra ba dag tu gyur to; ;khyod kyis sems can phru ba 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de dag ni dge slong rnams la rim gro byed pa'i lha 'bangs su gyur te /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas gtun 'dra ba dag tu gyur to; ;khyod kyis sems can phru ba 'dra ba gang dag mthong ba de dag ni dge slong rnams la rim gro byed pa'i lha 'bangs su gyur te /
translated: “You may wonder, ‘What were those beings who were like pots?’ They were gods who served the monks.

original: de dag sman skol bar byed pa na /
analyzed: de dag sman skol bar byed pa na /
translated: When they were boiling medicine,

original: dge slong rnams kyis mi snyan par smra ba dang / de dag sems rab tu khros pas phru ba de dag bcag pas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis mi snyan par smra ba dang / de dag sems rab tu khros pas phru ba de dag bcag pas /
translated: The monks said unpleasant things to them, and because they were very angry, they broke the bowls.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas phru ba 'dra ba dag tu gyur to //
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas phru ba 'dra ba dag tu gyur to //
translated: As the result of that action, they were reborn in the bowls.🔽“You saw the beings with broken backs who were held together by sinews.

original: khyod kyis sems can rked pa chad pa chu rgyus kyis bzung ba gang dag mthong ba de dag kyang dge slong rnyed pa stobs pa dag tu gyur pa na /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can rked pa chad pa chu rgyus kyis bzung ba gang dag mthong ba de dag kyang dge slong rnyed pa stobs pa dag tu gyur pa na /
translated: When they were monks who were distributing the offerings,

original: de dag ser snas zil gyis non pas rnyed pa bsgyur te /🔽dbyar gyi rnyed pa gang yin pa da ni dgun gyir bsgyur /
analyzed: de dag ser snas zil gyis non pas rnyed pa bsgyur te / dbyar gyi rnyed pa gang yin pa da ni dgun gyir bsgyur /
translated: they were overcome by stinginess and they changed the offerings.🔽They changed the offerings of the summer to those of the winter,

original: dgun gyi gang yin pa @162b de ni dbyar gyir bsgyur bas /
analyzed: dgun gyi gang yin pa @162b de ni dbyar gyir bsgyur bas /
translated: and those of the winter to those of the summer.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas rked pa chad pa chu rgyus kyis bzung ba dag tu gyur to //
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas rked pa chad pa chu rgyus kyis bzung ba dag tu gyur to //
translated: As the result of that action, they were reborn with broken backs held together by sinews.

original: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks, feeling doubtful, inquired of the Buddha, the Blessed One, the one who clears away all doubts,

original: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos las ci zhig bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun 'tshos las ci zhig bgyis na /
translated: “Noble one, what action did the venerable Saṅgharakṣita take

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas phyug pa nor mang ba longs spyod che ba'i khyim du skyes shing dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis pa dang / gdul ba'i don chen po bgyis par gyur /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas phyug pa nor mang ba longs spyod che ba'i khyim du skyes shing dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis pa dang / gdul ba'i don chen po bgyis par gyur /
translated: that ripened into his birth into a family of great means, prosperity, and wealth, and that he manifested arhatship and accomplished great benefit for those to be guided?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: yab yum de ni bdag nyid lags te /

translated: “Upāli, if someone who wishes to go forth approaches any of you,🔽you should ask, ‘You have not killed your mother, have you? You have not killed your father, have you?
